content.title: The person
paragraphs: Hello, my name is Rafael, I'm {{age}} and I'm from São Paulo, Brazil. Besides being a programmer, I'm a human being, also a Corinthians huge fan, an anarcho-capitalism enthusiast and a lover of coffee, philosophy and politics.

content.title: The programmer
paragraphs: I work at BRQ, an IT services company, by building web apps and Windows programs using the .NET platform, mostly with C#. In my free times, I like to search about new technologies and its best practices, to test what I've learned by creating little and useless projects, and to seek for minimum details to fix in this website that nobody would notice. I'm interested, most of all, in web development with .NET (ASP.NET, ASP.NET Core and NancyFx) and with Node.js (Express and Koa), mobile (Xamarin and native) and for UWP platform.

content.title: The student
paragraphs: Currently studying Information Systems at FIAP. But, even before I entered the universitarian life, I used to study about programming. Actually, I do it since when I had my first contact with computing, in my vocational and technical high school, when I was 14 years old. Curiously, I started with VB.NET and C#, which certainly influenced my career.
